item.title: An Interesting Question of Stack.
item.description: I read an article on the internet several days ago which raised a question about stack. The question is that how to get the smallest number for the best practice when pushing data on a stack and then poping it. I try to write down it in golang. Please have a look. package main import "fmt" type Stack struct { source []int data []int small int } func (s *Stack) push() { for _, val := range s.

item.title: Write a Simple Crawler.
item.description: 1. Basic process. HTTP request -> Web -> HTTP response -> Parse data -> Handle data This is the basic process of a crawler program. I will not talk about concurrency or distributed framework here. This article aim to give a simple introduction of crawler. A crawler actually is a script which execute simulation of our action very fast when we browse a web page and it follows some rules we designed for catching our data.
